intro: Cynoglossum hispidum, commonly known as hairy tongue of the mountain, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cynoglossum hispidum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
